results.title: Fever pitch
results.creator_credit: Wildgaze Films, Amanda Posey and David Evans
results.brief_description: Paul Ashworth discovers his passion for soccer when he accompanies his father to an Arsenal game. 24 years later, he still has the same passion, and is an unorthodox, deeply pessimistic thirty something English teacher. The highs and lows of Arsenal’s performance mirrors that in Paul’s personal life, thus the two worlds intermingle. Enter Sarah, and a relationship develops between two people that think the other one is either uptight or a soccer lout. As their relationship develops, Paul must question the distinction and importance between his personal life and his sporting fanaticism, as he is faced with the choice of deciding between following Arsenal’s first chance to win the championship in 18 years, or to pursue love. Cast includes Colin Firth, Ruth Gemmell, Neil Pearson and Lorraine Ashbourne. Based on the novel by Nick Hornby.

results.title: Fetishes
results.creator_credit: Home Box Office, Nicholas Broomfield and Michele D'Acosta
results.brief_description: Pandora’s Box is an exclusive high class S & M parlour in Manhattan. Mistress Raven - previously a Long Island housewife, became New York’s most famous mistress and later retired to become the founder of Pandora’s Box. The documentary covers the functions of her parlour and various aspects of S & M; corporal punishment, whipping/slapping, wrestling fetish, rubber fetish, infantilism, slaves, humiliation, mistresses etc. The documentary provides insights into the personal aspirations of Raven’s crew of dominatrix (Mistress Natasha, Catherine, and Delilah) with vivid footage of the parlour in operation.

results.title: Festival express
results.creator_credit: Apollo Films, Peachtree Films, Gavin Poolman, John Trapman and Bob Smeaton
results.brief_description: In the summer of 1970, two Canadian music promoters decided to put on a touring music festival. Instead of the artists meeting at each location, they put everyone on a train that went from city to city. What a ride! This documentary is a re-discovery of the musical journey that took place and for some the great emotional journey from the vibe and friendship/good times that happened on the train. Never before had performers been so well looked after and the train became a place for one hell of party - Buddy Guy says at one point he tried to sleep but was worried he might miss something - one car was for blues jamming, one for folk, one for food and one for, well, other activities. The whole event ran at a great loss, word on the street was that the concerts should be free and youth of the day would charge the gates causing trouble at every town. That is why this footage was not uncovered for more that 30 years, no one had any money at the end of it to produce the film and it just sat in a vault! Some split-screen technique is used combining contemporary interviews with original footage or simply showing the two points-of-view of a two camera shot. Performers featured are: “The Band”, “Delaney and Bonnie”, “The Flying Burrito Brothers”, “Grateful Dead”, “Buddy Guy Blues Band”, “Ian & Sylvia & The Great Speckled Bird”, “Janis Joplin”, “Mashmakhan” and “Sha Na Na”. Cities visited include Toronto, Winnipeg and Calgary (with a stop at a liquor store to re-stock!). Two disc set contains lots of extras.

results.title: Ferris Bueller's day off [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, John Hughes and Tom Jacobson
results.brief_description: A 1961 Ferrari 250 GT California. It was one man’s love, his passion, and his fault he didn’t lock the garage when Ferris Bueller wanted the day off. One day, towards the end of his senior year, Ferris (Matthew Broderick), cuts school and heads for downtown Chicago with his girl Sloane and his best friend Cameron, to show what a little ingenuity, a lot of nerve, and a red Ferrari can do. From John Hughes comes a contemporary comedy which follows Ferris’ wildly audacious and nearly flawless plan to take it easy. Featuring a soundtrack from artists including Yello, Big Audio Dynamite, Sigue Sigue Sputnik, The Beat, The Beatles and The Dream Academy. Also stars Alan Ruck and Mia Sara. Cinematography, Tak Fujimoto. Script, John Hughes.

results.title: Female perversions
results.creator_credit: Mindy Affrime Productions, Mindy Affrime and Susan Streitfeld
results.brief_description: This fascinating, fragmented and complex drama eschews traditional narrative structure to present an intellectually challenging, feminist adaptation of Louise Kaplan’s book “Female Perversions: the Temptations of Emma Bovary.” The film centres on Eve, a talented lawyer who has just won a case against a disreputable business magnate. However, anticipating a meeting with the governor regarding her aspirations to become a judge brings to the surface insecurities and anxieties. She compensates for her lack of self-esteem by relying more and more on her captivating looks, and by buying expensive lingerie and make-up. Just as Eve is facing the highest point in her life, Madelyn, her unstable sister, is experiencing her lowest when she is arrested for shoplifting. When an incident from their childhood resurfaces, both sisters must confront their painful issues and find some sense of control in their lives. Cast includes: Tilda Swinton, Amy Madigan, Karen Sillas, Laila Robins and Clancy Brown.

results.title: Felicia's journey
results.creator_credit: Marquis Films, Alliance Atlantis, Screenventures, Bruce Davey and Atom Egoyan
results.brief_description: Atom Egoyan’s second literary adaptation (“The Sweet Hereafter” was the first) is a dark yet comic tale of the powerful influence of childhood and the search for contentment in life’s journey. Pregnant and alone, Felicia (Elaine Cassidy) leaves her native home of Ireland in search of Johnny, father of her unborn child. Arriving in Birmingham with few clues as to his location, she meets factory canteen manager Mr Hilditch (Bob Hoskins), a seemingly benevolent gent who offers to help Felicia find lodgings and her love. Hilditchs’ home is a time capsule of 1950’s homewear, and he spends his evenings watching footage of his mother, Gala (Arsinee Khanjian), a successful television chef, and himself as a young child in the background. The relationship revealed throughout the footage is deliciously tinged with antagonism and pain, something that remains with Hilditch throughout his adult life and appears to have influenced his relationship with women. Felicia is not the first wayward soul assisted by Mr Hilditch, as it is revealed he has recorded the innermost thoughts of numerous other women he has picked up in his car - Felicia appears to be the next in line. Cast also includes Peter McDonald, Gerard McSorley and Claire Benedict. Based on the novel by William Trevor.

results.title: Fearless vampire killers or pardon me but your teeth are in my neck
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Gene Gutowski and Roman Polanski
results.brief_description: A mixture of parody, horror film and fairytale, this film about a kindly old fanatic and his incompetent young assistant who take on a castle of thirsty vampires armed only with cowardice, stupidity and a sharp stake, was described by Polanski as “a cartoon with people”. Although his film is at core voyeuristically heterosexual, Polanski makes the homoerotic aspect of the vampire film explicit. The high point is the macabrely beautiful great vampire ball. Cast includes Jack MacGowran, Sharon Tate, Alfie Bass, Ferdy Mayne, Terry Downes, Fiona Lewis, Iain Quarrier and Jessie Robbins.

results.title: Fearless
results.creator_credit: Mark Rosenberg, Peter Weir, Warner Bros Pictures and Paula Weinstein
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Rafael Yglesias, Peter Weir’s “Fearless” is a moving examination of the effects of surviving an airline crash. Max Klein (Jeff Bridges) is a successful San Fransiscan architect with a strong fear of flying. When he survives an airline crash his life changes completely. He believes he is invincible - he becomes fearless. Max emerges as the hero of the crash when he helps people out of the wrecked plane, but afterwards he becomes estranged from his wife (Isabella Rossellini) and son. Despite attempts by airline psychologist Bill Pearlman (John Turturro) to get Max to participate in his group therapy sessions, Max is happy to defy fate at every turn. The only person he can share his experiences with is Carla Rodrigo (Rosie Perez) who lost her young son in the crash. Max tries to ‘save’ Carla, who has lost the will to live, but who can save Max from his need to test the limits of his existence? A remarkable and riveting film with an excellent cast. The scenes of the planecrash are eerily realistic - don’t watch this before flying!

results.title: Fear eats the soul = Angst essen seele auf
results.creator_credit: Tango Film, Christian Hohoff and Rainer Werner Fassbinder
results.brief_description: Fear eats the soul is prolific German director Rainer Werner Fassbinder’s unsentimental interpretation of Douglas Sirk’s “All that heaven allows”. In this tough blend of social realism and Hollywood melodrama, Fassbinder examines racism and class in the love affair between an elderly German widow (Brigitte Mira) and a young Arab immigrant (played by Fassbinder’s lover at the time El Hedi ben Salem) which is met with hostility and derision from their family and friends. Considered the leading director of the ‘new German cinema’, Fassbinder had already dealt with this subject matter in his 1970 feature “The American soldier”. Winner of the International critics prize, Cannes Film Festival 1974. In German with English subtitles.

details.label: Subject categories
display_values: Advertising, Film, Journalism, Mass Media & TV → Foreign language films

results.title: Faust
results.creator_credit: UFA, Erich Pommer and Friedrich W. Murnau
results.brief_description: Classic silent German cinema from the talented F.W.Murnau, 1926. “The portals of darkness are open and the shadows of the dead hunt over the earth..” opens the film with the prevailing theme of good versus evil as the devil Mephisto does a deal with alchemist Faust for his soul and potentially for dominion over the Earth - promising he will stop the plague that is rife throughout Faust’s village. Faust reneges on the arrangement choosing love - much to the delight of Archangel St. Michael. Based on the original story by Goethe. Great cinematography and effects give the film a dark foreboding and general creepiness that add to the dramatic impact of the work. This edition features orchestral soundtrack by the Olympia Chamber Orchestra.
